title: Valley of the Dead
data:
| Valley of the Dead                                  |                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| Location                                            | Level 1 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | Yes                                              |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | No                                               |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                               |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                               |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                               |

The **Valley of the Dead** is the first level of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), located immediately below the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). There is no downstairs on the castle level; you must either drop in via one of the [trap doors](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door") in the Castle, or teleport in with controlled [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport"). [Level teleporting](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport") down from above, trying to skip the Valley, will land you in it instead, though level teleport from the Valley itself will work. Somewhere near the lower right is an up staircase; walking up these stairs will place you in a random location in the maze to the right of the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). The [mysterious force](/wiki/Mysterious_force "Mysterious force") no longer affects you as you go up from the Valley.

The level layout is always the same. It contains several [graveyards](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard") and a [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple") of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch"), with attending priest. The entrance to the rest of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") is behind a [secret door](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door"), accessible through the temple. As the Valley of the Dead is part of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), prayer will anger your [deity](/wiki/God "God").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
    - [3.2.1 External Sources](#External_Sources)
  - [3.3 TNNT (the game)](#TNNT_.28the_game.29)

## Map

The layout of the Valley is almost fixed:

\----------------------------------------------------------------------------  
|[>](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase").[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").|..|.....|  |.....-|      |................|   |......[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")........| |...|  
\|---|[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")|.--.---.|  |......--- ----..........-----.-----....---........---.-.|  
|   |.|.|..| |.| --........BBB.............|   |.......---| |-...........--|  
|   |...[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")..| |.| |.[grave](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard").-----.......------|   |--------..---......------- |  
\|----------- |[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")| |-......| |....|...-- |...-----................----       |  
|.....[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")....---.| |.......| |....|...|  |..............-----------          |  
|.....|.|......| |.....--- |......---  |....---.......|                    |  
|.....|.|------| |....--   --....-- |---AAAA- ----aaaa---------------      |  
|.....|--......---...-|     |...--  |.......|    |..................|      |  
|..[\_](/wiki/Altar "Altar").......||...c....-|    --...|   |.......|    |...||.............|      |  
|.....|...-||-..c.....------....|   |.[grave](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard").---- |...||.............--     |  
|.....|--......---...[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap").....b.--------..........| |.......---------...--    |  
|.....| |CCCCCC| |--.......--|   |.........----- -----....| |.|  |....---  |  
|.....| |......--| ------..| |----.........|       |.--------.-- |-.....---|  
\|------ |.[grave](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard")..|  |.|....| |.....----....---------...........---.........|  
|       |........|  |...|..| |.....|  |-.............--------...........---|  
|       --.....-----------[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")| |....-----.....----------     |......[<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")..----  |  
|        |..|..............| |.|..........|.|              |.|........|    |  
\----------------------------------------------------------------------------

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") and later, for each of the pairs Aa, Bb, and Cc, either the uppercase or the lowercase letter, at random, is replaced with solid walls, and the other is replaced with floor tiles: this results in a 50% chance of having to pass through each graveyard. (In previous versions of NetHack, and in many variants, the map is fixed: ABC are always walls and abc are always floors, making all graveyards on the level optional.)

## Description

After falling or jumping through a [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") [trapdoor](/wiki/Trapdoor "Trapdoor"), you will land within a few squares of the up [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair"). The [unaligned](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple") on the left is attended by a peaceful [priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch"). In addition to the inhabitants of the three marked [graveyards](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard"), the level also contains six [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost"), three [vampire bats](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat"), four random [mummies](/wiki/Mummies "Mummies"), four random [zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)"), three random [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"), and a random [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)"). In addition to the boxes in the graveyards, there are four random pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), four random [weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), three random [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), three random [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), two random [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), two random [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring"), two random [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"), three random [tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool"), a ruby, and two other random [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"). In addition to the [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") in the graveyards, there are two other corpses of each character class placed randomly around the level, save for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"). As you go from the temple to the downstair, in the top left corridor are two [spiked pits](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit") and a [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap"), the trap in the center-left is a [squeaky board](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board"), the other two are [dart traps](/wiki/Dart_trap "Dart trap"), and there are a further two [magic traps](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap"), two [anti-magic traps](/wiki/Anti-magic_trap "Anti-magic trap") and one more squeaky board randomly located.

The entire level has [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable") walls and floor, and is unmappable: Attempting to cast a spell of [magic mapping](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping") or reading a [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping") will fail result in [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the level is [magic mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping"), and [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") is allowed.

The priest of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch") is hostile and cannot be pacified, [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") therefore can not be bought.

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") has an alternate version of the Valley of the Dead originally taken from the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"). Much like the original, it has a lit temple, the same traps and monsters, a lot of player corpses, and similar loot lying around. Unlike the original, though, the upstairs are in a different position, a river cuts through the valley, and [magic portals](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower"), the [Dragon Caves](/wiki/Dragon_Caves "Dragon Caves") and [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol") are at the marked positions.

#### External Sources

[GitHub level file](https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/master/dat/gehennom.des)

### TNNT (the game)

In [TNNT (the game)](/wiki/TNNT_\(the_game\) "TNNT (the game)"), the Valley of the Dead contains a [swap chest](/wiki/Swap_chest "Swap chest").

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-360}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

See the [page history](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Valley_of_the_Dead\&action=history) for a list of who changed it, and on what dates.
html:
Valley of the Dead

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Valley of the Dead
Location Level 1 of
Gehennom
Bones Yes
Mappable No
Teleportable No
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls No

The Valley of the Dead is the first level of Gehennom, located immediately below the Castle. There is no downstairs on the castle level; you must either drop in via one of the trap doors in the Castle, or teleport in with controlled level teleport. Level teleporting down from above, trying to skip the Valley, will land you in it instead, though level teleport from the Valley itself will work. Somewhere near the lower right is an up staircase; walking up these stairs will place you in a random location in the maze to the right of the Castle. The mysterious force no longer affects you as you go up from the Valley.

The level layout is always the same. It contains several graveyards and a temple of Moloch, with attending priest. The entrance to the rest of Gehennom is behind a secret door, accessible through the temple. As the Valley of the Dead is part of Gehennom, prayer will anger your deity.

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 UnNetHack
      • 3.2.1 External Sources
    • 3.3 TNNT (the game)

Map

The layout of the Valley is almost fixed:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
|>.^S.|..|.....|  |.....-|      |................|   |......^........| |...|
|---|^|.--.---.|  |......--- ----..........-----.-----....---........---.-.|
|   |.|.|..| |.| --........BBB.............|   |.......---| |-...........--|
|   |...S..| |.| |.grave.-----.......------|   |--------..---......------- |
|----------- |^| |-......| |....|...-- |...-----................----       |

|.....|...-||-..c.....------....|   |.grave.---- |...||.............--     |

|.....| |CCCCCC| |--.......--|   |.........----- -----....| |.|  |....---  |

|       --.....-----------^| |....-----.....----------     |......<..----  |
|        |..|..............| |.|..........|.|              |.|........|    |
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

In NetHack 3.6.0 and later, for each of the pairs Aa, Bb, and Cc, either the uppercase or the lowercase letter, at random, is replaced with solid walls, and the other is replaced with floor tiles: this results in a 50% chance of having to pass through each graveyard. (In previous versions of NetHack, and in many variants, the map is fixed: ABC are always walls and abc are always floors, making all graveyards on the level optional.)

Description

After falling or jumping through a Castle trapdoor, you will land within a few squares of the up stair. The unaligned temple on the left is attended by a peaceful priest of Moloch. In addition to the inhabitants of the three marked graveyards, the level also contains six ghosts, three vampire bats, four random mummies, four random zombies, three random vampires, and a random lich. In addition to the boxes in the graveyards, there are four random pieces of armor, four random weapons, three random potions, three random scrolls, two random wands, two random rings, two random spellbooks, three random tools, a ruby, and two other random gems. In addition to the corpses in the graveyards, there are two other corpses of each character class placed randomly around the level, save for Monks and Priests. As you go from the temple to the downstair, in the top left corridor are two spiked pits and a sleeping gas trap, the trap in the center-left is a squeaky board, the other two are dart traps, and there are a further two magic traps, two anti-magic traps and one more squeaky board randomly located.

The entire level has undiggable walls and floor, and is unmappable: Attempting to cast a spell of magic mapping or reading a scroll of magic mapping will fail result in confusion.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the level is magic mappable, and teleport is allowed.

The priest of Moloch is hostile and cannot be pacified, protection therefore can not be bought.

UnNetHack

UnNetHack has an alternate version of the Valley of the Dead originally taken from the Lethe patch. Much like the original, it has a lit temple, the same traps and monsters, a lot of player corpses, and similar loot lying around. Unlike the original, though, the upstairs are in a different position, a river cuts through the valley, and magic portals to Vlad's Tower, the Dragon Caves and Sheol are at the marked positions.

TNNT (the game)

In TNNT (the game), the Valley of the Dead contains a swap chest.

{{level|Valley of the Dead| |branch=Gehennom |from=1|to=1 |bones=yes |teleport=no |mapping=no |digfloor=no |digwalls=no }} The '''Valley of the Dead''' is the first level of [[Gehennom]], located immediately below the [[Castle]]. There is no downstairs on the castle level; you must either drop in via one of the [[trap door]]s in the Castle, or teleport in with controlled [[level teleport]]. [[Level teleport]]ing down from above, trying to skip the Valley, will land you in it instead, though level teleport from the Valley itself will work. Somewhere near the lower right is an up staircase; walking up these stairs will place you in a random location in the maze to the right of the [[Castle]]. The [[mysterious force]] no longer affects you as you go up from the Valley. The level layout is always the same. It contains several [[graveyard]]s and a [[temple]] of [[Moloch]], with attending priest. The entrance to the rest of [[Gehennom]] is behind a [[secret door]], accessible through the temple. As the Valley of the Dead is part of [[Gehennom]], prayer will anger your [[God|deity]]. == Map == The layout of the Valley is almost fixed:
^=[[trap|{{white|^}}]] grave=[[graveyard|{{white|g}}{{white|r}}{{white|a}}{{white|v}}{{white|e}}]] A={{brightcyan|A}} a={{brightcyan|a}} C={{yellow|B}} c={{yellow|b}} D={{brightmagenta|C}} d={{brightmagenta|c}} ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |>.^S.|..|.....| |.....-| |................| |......^........| |...| |---|^|.--.---.| |......--- ----..........-----.-----....---........---.-.| | |.|.|..| |.| --........CCC.............| |.......---| |-...........--| | |...S..| |.| |.grave.-----.......------| |--------..---......------- | |----------- |^| |-......| |....|...-- |...-----................---- | |.....S....---.| |.......| |....|...| |..............----------- | |.....|.|......| |.....--- |......--- |....---.......| | |.....|.|------| |....-- --....-- |---AAAA- ----aaaa--------------- | |.....|--......---BBB-| |...-- |.......| |..................| | |.._.......||...d....-| --...| |.......| |...||.............| | |.....|...-||-..d.....------....| |.grave.---- |...||.............-- | |.....|--......---...^.....c.--------..........| |.......---------...-- | |.....| |DDDDDD| |--.......--| |..B......----- -----....| |.| |....--- | |.....| |......--| ------..| |----..B......| |.--------.-- |-.....---| |------ |.grave..| |.|....| |.....----BBBB---------...........---.........| | |........| |...|..| |.....| |-.............--------...........---| | --.....-----------^| |....-----.....---------- |......<..---- | | |..|..B...........| |.|..........|.| |.|........| | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
In [[NetHack 3.6.0]] and later, for each of the pairs {{brightcyan|Aa}}, {{yellow|Bb}}, and {{brightmagenta|Cc}}, either the uppercase or the lowercase letter, at random, is replaced with solid walls, and the other is replaced with floor tiles: this results in a 50% chance of having to pass through each graveyard. (In previous versions of NetHack, and in many variants, the map is fixed: {{brightcyan|A}}{{yellow|B}}{{brightmagenta|C}} are always walls and {{brightcyan|a}}{{yellow|b}}{{brightmagenta|c}} are always floors, making all graveyards on the level optional.) ==Description== After falling or jumping through a [[Castle]] [[trapdoor]], you will land within a few squares of the up [[stair]]. The [[alignment|unaligned]] [[temple]] on the left is attended by a peaceful [[aligned priest|priest]] of [[Moloch]]. In addition to the inhabitants of the three marked [[graveyard]]s, the level also contains six [[ghost]]s, three [[vampire bat]]s, four random [[mummies]], four random [[Zombie (monster class)|zombies]], three random [[Vampire (monster class)|vampires]], and a random [[Lich (monster class)|lich]]. In addition to the boxes in the graveyards, there are four random pieces of [[armor]], four random [[weapon]]s, three random [[potion]]s, three random [[scroll]]s, two random [[wand]]s, two random [[ring]]s, two random [[spellbook]]s, three random [[tool]]s, a ruby, and two other random [[gem]]s. In addition to the [[corpse]]s in the graveyards, there are two other corpses of each character class placed randomly around the level, save for [[Monk]]s and [[Priest]]s. As you go from the temple to the downstair, in the top left corridor are two [[spiked pit]]s and a [[sleeping gas trap]], the trap in the center-left is a [[squeaky board]], the other two are [[dart trap]]s, and there are a further two [[magic trap]]s, two [[anti-magic trap]]s and one more squeaky board randomly located. The entire level has [[undiggable]] walls and floor, and is unmappable: Attempting to cast a spell of [[magic mapping]] or reading a [[scroll of magic mapping]] will fail result in [[confusion]]. ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], the level is [[magic mapping|magic mappable]], and [[teleport]] is allowed. The priest of [[Moloch]] is hostile and cannot be pacified, [[protection]] therefore can not be bought. ===UnNetHack=== [[UnNetHack]] has an alternate version of the Valley of the Dead originally taken from the [[Lethe patch]]. Much like the original, it has a lit temple, the same traps and monsters, a lot of player corpses, and similar loot lying around. Unlike the original, though, the upstairs are in a different position, a river cuts through the valley, and [[magic portal]]s to [[Vlad's Tower]], the [[Dragon Caves]] and [[Sheol]] are at the marked positions.
